title: Bringing the social and ethical responsibilities of computing to the forefront
summary: The Social and Ethical Responsibilities of Computing (SERC) initiative at MIT recently held a symposium to explore the societal and ethical implications of algorithms and artificial intelligence (AI). The event brought together experts from various disciplines to discuss the challenges and opportunities presented by the broad applicability of algorithms and AI in society. Topics covered included biased sensor data, equitable health care, and the role of ethics in computing education. The symposium highlighted the need for new conceptual frameworks and ethical guidelines to navigate the profound changes brought about by AI and algorithms.
